javadoc.name: KeyStoreSerializerImpl
javadoc.comment: Implements serialization of {@link KeyStoreItem} into {@link ItemSerializer}.
javadoc.author: Tomas Polesovsky

method.name: getSerializerUID
method.comment: Returns constant {@link #SERIALIZER_UID}.

method.name: getSupportedClass
method.comment: Returns {@link KeyStoreItem}.

method.name: read
method.comment:
Reads content of the serializedItem and tries to create a new {@link KeyStoreItem} with loaded {@link KeyStore}.

Uses {@link SerializedItem#getHeader()} to obtain KeyStore type and creates new KeyStore using {@link KeyStore#load(java.io.InputStream, char[])}.

param.name: serializedItem
param.comment: the serialized item to be converted

throws.name: ItemSerializerException
throws.comment: if the serializedItem is null, itemStream is null or if fails KeyStore instantiation or loading from the input stream.

method.name: write
method.comment:
Serializes the item into InputStream using {@link KeyStore#store(java.io.OutputStream stream, char[] password)} method.

{@link com.liferay.portalsafe.util.CryptoService#getPassword(long)} is used to store internal representation of the KeyStore into stream.

KeyStore type is written into SerializedItem header to be used for deserialization.

param.name: item
param.comment: the item with KeyStore to be serialized

return.comment: the serialized item with KeyStore saved as InputStream

throws.name: ItemSerializerException
throws.comment: if the item is null, if {@link KeyStoreItem#getKeyStore()} is null or if serialization of the KeyStore fails

javadoc.name: PortalSafeLocalServiceImpl
javadoc.comment:
The implementation of the portal safe local service.

All custom service methods should be put in this class. Whenever methods are added, rerun ServiceBuilder to copy their definitions into the {@link com.liferay.portalsafe.service.PortalSafeLocalService} interface.

This is a local service. Methods of this service will not have security checks based on the propagated JAAS credentials because this service can only be accessed from within the same VM.
javadoc.author: Brian Wing Shun Chan

method.comment: Returns registered storage implementation or {@link FSStorageImpl} if there is no storage registered.

param.name: groupId

All custom service methods should be put in this class. Whenever methods are added, rerun ServiceBuilder to copy their definitions into the {@link com.liferay.portalsafe.service.PortalSafeService} interface.

This is a remote service. Methods of this service are expected to have security checks based on the propagated JAAS credentials because this service can be accessed remotely.
